code:
import turtle

t1 = turtle.Turtle()
t1.pencolor('white')

t1.color('red')

t2 = turtle.Turtle()
t2.color('green')

guide.img: red, you can see the turtle object in the output screen changing its colour when you run the code.
guide.code:
import turtle

t1 = turtle.Turtle()
t1.pencolor('white')

t1.color('red')

guide.img: Now we are creating another turtle object named t2
guide.code:
import turtle

t1 = turtle.Turtle()
t1.pencolor('white')

t1.color('red')

t2 = turtle.Turtle()

guide.img: We are Setting the Colour of the Second turtle object to green. now the green arrow will lay on top of the red arrow making the red arrow disappear.
guide.code:
import turtle

t1 = turtle.Turtle()
t1.pencolor('white')

t1.color('red')

t2 = turtle.Turtle()
t2.color('green')
